intro: Homalium mathieuanum, commonly known as the red-berried evergreen, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, glossy evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various birds and wildlife. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
